P.title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark ruling on digital privacy rights by 2030?

P.title: Will the Amazon rainforest's rate of deforestation decrease by 30% by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the rate of deforestation in the Amazon rainforest has decreased by at least 30% compared to the rate recorded in the year 2020.
The assessment of the deforestation rate will be based on data provided by the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) of Brazil, or any other authoritative source recognized by the international scientific community.
In the event that INPE or equivalent authoritative data is not available for 2025, this question will resolve using the most recent data available from these sources prior to 2025.
For the purpose of this question, "deforestation" refers to the permanent removal of primary forest cover in the Amazon basin. Temporary changes in forest cover due to natural events (e.g., fires, floods) that are expected to recover naturally do not count towards the deforestation rate.

P.title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in image recognition by 2025?
P.body:

"Human accuracy" refers to the average accuracy rate of a group of humans (at least 100 individuals) performing the same image recognition tasks under controlled conditions.

P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global average temperature has risen by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels (defined as the average global temperature from 1850-1900). In the event that the IPCC or equivalent body does not provide a clear statement or report by the resolution date, this question will resolve based on the consensus of reports from at least three major scientific organizations dedicated to climate science. P.title: Will the United Nations establish a global AI ethics framework by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Nations (UN) has officially established a global framework for artificial intelligence (AI) ethics. The framework must be designed to guide the development, deployment, and governance of AI technologies on a global scale. The establishment of the framework must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must include specific guidelines or principles addressing ethical considerations related to AI, such as transparency, accountability, privacy, and fairness. In the event of a partial or preliminary framework, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear commitment and timeline for the adoption of a comprehensive global framework.

P.title: Will a new infectious disease emerge with a global infection rate exceeding 1% before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a new infectious disease emerges with a global infection rate exceeding 1% of the world's population. The infection rate must be confirmed by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). For the purpose of this question, a "new infectious disease" refers to a pathogen not previously identified in humans before the date of this question. The global infection rate is defined as the percentage of the world's population confirmed to be infected by the disease, as reported by the WHO or CDC. In the absence of direct reports from these organizations, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. In the event of conflicting reports, the average of the reported rates from these sources will be used to determine the resolution. This question does not consider the severity of the disease or the death rate, focusing solely on the infection rate.

P.title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Russo-Ukrainian War has directly led to significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies. Significant advancements are defined as:
- The development and deployment of new cybersecurity technologies or methodologies that represent a substantial improvement over existing capabilities.
- The adoption of these technologies or methodologies by major governments, corporations, or cybersecurity organizations.

Advancements must be directly attributable to the challenges or experiences derived from the Russo-Ukrainian War. This can include, but is not limited to, enhanced intrusion detection systems, improved encryption methods, or novel approaches to cybersecurity education and training.

Confirmation of such advancements must come from credible sources, including official government statements, reports from reputable cybersecurity firms, or coverage in major technology or news publications (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, BBC, The New York Times). In the absence of direct statements, consensus among cybersecurity experts, as reported in multiple reputable sources, will be sufficient.

In the event of ambiguous advancements, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear consensus among experts that the advancements are both significant and directly attributable to the war.

P.title: Will Amazon deploy an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially deployed an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management across any of its operational warehouses. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
